attributes.action: use the vast amount of money raised through extortionate petrol duty, road tax, and council taxes, to repair the roads to a satisfactory standard equivalent to those in the other affluent EU nations.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Vehicle users are currently paying 3 forms of tax; 2 directly linked with transport on the roads, and 1 that should cover the local road network. Local councils are continually implementing speed bump and road narrowing systems to slow down traffic instead of repairing the roads that are causing increased wear on tyres and suspension systems to the point where it is costing hundreds of pounds a year for additional or more frequent repairs. We have the worst roads in Western Europe and as such the major continental tyre manufacturers produce different tyres for the UK market than the rest of Europe to endure our road network. Surely the recent increases in fuel duty as a result of the increasing cost of oil could cover some of the repairs...
